channel.title: (PHP Retard) Help with a code
channel.description:
My shitty piece of very basic web page i started maybe 10 minutes ago, i saved it in .html and it is not working could someone help me out? I have downloaded PHP5, and i tried saving in .php still nothing. could someone point out what is wrong with my code? [code] Cryme Times Page
Links Links Links Links

Page 1 Page 2 Page 3 Page 4

Suggestions? Send Some.

?> [/code]

item.title: (PHP Retard) Help with a code
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

…
Yes indeed, a PHP retard.

You have to make it a .php file, not a .htm file, duh.

And PHP is server side, so you have to upload it to a web hoster to view it.

EDIT: You can view it if you have PHP installed on your computer properly. You don’t just install it, you need to follow a guide.

Read full topic

item.title: (PHP Retard) Help with a code
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Well lets start off by saying… You NEED to save it as .php

Plus the only way you will see if it works with php or not, is if you have a webserver. Such as a free host that supports php. Or one like xampp or wamp. (Not going into detail about this)

Also, you need a mail server on your computer too. Or if you have a domain and hoster you should be good.

But here use this instead too:

[code]

Cryme Times Page
Links Links Links Links
Page 1 Page 2 Page 3 Page 4
Page 1 Page 2 Page 3 Page 4

Suggestions? Send Some.

<?php $email = $_REQUEST['email']; $subject = $_REQUEST['sub']; $message = $_REQUEST['message']; if ($email != '' && $subject != '' && $message != '') { mail("xxxcrymetime@gmail.com", "Subject: $subject" . $message."", "From: $email"); echo ""; } else { ?> Your Email:

Subject:

Message:


<?php } ?> [/code]

Read full topic
